task.title: Enabling Community Portal Users
task.abstract: Staff users must enable an external user's Contact record as a Customer User in order to access the Community Portal. External users cannot be deleted; instead, the user must be deactivated in order to restrict their access to the Community Portal.

ul.li: Create an Account or ContactThe Contact Owner must be assigned a Role in order to enable the new Community User.

step.cmd: Navigate to the Contacts tab in the eBusiness app and select an existing Contact.
Select the Manage External User drop-down button on the Contact record and click Enable Customer User.
step.info: Alternatively, select the Manage External Account drop-down button on the Account record and click Enable Partner.

step.cmd: Enter, or edit, the user's First Name, Last Name, and Email.
step.info: The Alias, Username, and Nickname fields autopopulate based upon the Email field.

step.cmd: Select the User License and Profile from the picklists. Click Save.
step.info: The available profiles depend on the assigned User License. Profiles contain settings and permissions, which control the functions the user can perform and field level visibility.

taskbody.result: The Contact, or Account, is enabled and can access the Community Portal.

ul.li: Navigate to the Contact record and select the Manage External User drop-down button and click Log in to Community as User.
Once logged in to the Community Portal, authenticated users can select among their Sites and Communities from a drop-down menu in the supernav.
